title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A new survey shows 33.7% of Boston residents feel 'less safe' downtown, down from 70.6% last year.
The Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit discussed drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure issues on Thursday night.
Retail vacancies in downtown Boston are at their lowest since the pandemic, linked to improved safety perceptions.

title: Patriots 24, Falcons 14 (3rd): Borregales’ FG gives Pats breathing room
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lead Falcons 24-14 in the third quarter after a Borregales field goal.
Drake Maye struggles against Falcons' top-ranked pass defense, including a critical interception and strip-sack.
Patriots' Kayshon Boutte ruled out with hamstring injury; Christian Elliss questionable to return.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted in a Massachusetts statewide sex trafficking case, involving trafficking across four counties from March 2023 to September 2025.
Gianni Martinez, 23, of Lynn, accused of trafficking, recruiting women for sexual servitude, and continuing activities from jail.
Martinez's grandmother, Rosa Garcia, charged with deriving support from prostitution and money laundering; multiple alleged buyers also indicted.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'SNL' on Nov. 2, marking his second time as host, with Brandi Carlile as musical guest.
The episode featured a political cold open with Teller participating in a mock NYC mayoral debate sketch.
Brandi Carlile returned for her fourth musical guest appearance, previously performing with Elton John in Season 50.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts regulators partially denied Eversource's gas rate hike, saving customers $45 million in heating costs this winter.
The Department of Public Utilities found Eversource failed to meet key performance metrics on safety, reliability, and emissions.
Governor Healey criticized the proposed rate increases as unaffordable, urging further action to reduce winter heating costs.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School is investigating a racist incident involving a Black student's jersey hung on a plastic figure in a locker room.
Principal Allyson Mizoguchi confirmed that the students responsible have been identified and emphasized the impact on the school community.
Wayland police are working with the Middlesex District Attorney's Office and the Anti-Defamation League to address the incident.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Kevin Durant led the Houston Rockets to a 128-101 win over the Celtics, ending Boston's three-game winning streak.
Exhaustion played a role in the Celtics' defeat, marking their third game in four days with significant travel.
Baylor Scheierman stood out for Boston, scoring 17 points and showing defensive prowess despite the team's overall struggles.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson to 53-man roster after Rhamondre Stevenson suffers toe injury.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, may debut against the Falcons, bringing experience to the Patriots' depleted backfield.
New England's running game relies on TreVeyon Henderson, Terrell Jennings, and possibly Johnson for Sunday's matchup.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form a new top defensive pairing for the Boston Bruins.
The Bruins have improved defensively, allowing only one 5-on-5 goal in 73:24 minutes with the McAvoy-Zadorov duo.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Jonathan Aspirot's play also contribute to Bruins' recent defensive success.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman delivered a strong performance in a 2-1 win over Carolina, saving 27 of 28 shots.
Joonas Korpisalo received consecutive starts after Boston's 7-2 loss to Ottawa, posting a .933 save percentage in two wins.
Coach Marco Sturm emphasized the rotation flexibility, trusting both Swayman and Korpisalo to elevate team competitiveness.
